title: Daniel Penny trial: Judge drops top manslaughter charge, allows lesser charge
content: A jury in Manhattan is deadlocked on the manslaughter charge against Daniel Penny, a Marine veteran accused of fatally choking Jordan Neely on a subway train. The judge gave an Allen charge, urging further deliberation. The jury may consider a lesser charge if the deadlock persists. The case has fueled debate about race, mental health, and public safety.
summary: A jury in Manhattan is deadlocked on the manslaughter charge against Daniel Penny, a Marine veteran accused of fatally choking Jordan Neely on a subway train.  The judge gave an Allen charge, urging further deliberation. The jury may consider a lesser charge if the deadlock persists. The case has fueled debate about race, mental health, and public safety.

title: ‘I did the best I could’: Tim Walz reflects on presidential loss
content: In his first post-election interview, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz expressed surprise at the Democratic ticket's loss, reflecting on the perceived momentum that ultimately didn't translate into victory. He acknowledged the need for self-reflection while avoiding direct criticism of Kamala Harris's campaign. Walz has now shifted focus back to Minnesota's evenly split House, expressing optimism about navigating the challenging political landscape.
summary: In his first post-election interview, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz expressed surprise at the Democratic ticket's loss, reflecting on the perceived momentum that ultimately didn't translate into victory.  He acknowledged the need for self-reflection while avoiding direct criticism of Kamala Harris's campaign.  Walz has now shifted focus back to Minnesota's evenly split House, expressing optimism about navigating the challenging political landscape.

title: Could Hawk Tuah girl be arrested for her crypto scam? Truth behind the viral claim
content: Hailey Welch, the "Hawk Tuah" girl, launched a cryptocurrency that crashed after reaching a $490 million market cap, leading to accusations of a "pump and dump" scheme and demands for her arrest. Welch denied wrongdoing, claiming her team hadn't sold any tokens, but faces potential legal action from investors who lost millions.
summary: Hailey Welch, the "Hawk Tuah" girl, launched a cryptocurrency that crashed after reaching a $490 million market cap, leading to accusations of a "pump and dump" scheme and demands for her arrest.  Welch denied wrongdoing, claiming her team hadn't sold any tokens, but faces potential legal action from investors who lost millions.

title: Boston City councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson arrested on federal fraud charges
content: Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson was arrested on federal fraud charges, accused of orchestrating a kickback scheme involving a relative and misusing public funds. Anderson allegedly gave an inflated bonus to a family member, who then returned a portion of the money to her. Mayor Wu has called for Anderson's resignation, citing a breach of public trust.
summary: Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson was arrested on federal fraud charges, accused of orchestrating a kickback scheme involving a relative and misusing public funds. Anderson allegedly gave an inflated bonus to a family member, who then returned a portion of the money to her. Mayor Wu has called for Anderson's resignation, citing a breach of public trust.

title: Trump taunts Canada at Fox event as crowd chants '51st state' amid tariff threats
content: At a Fox Nation awards ceremony, former President Trump recounted threatening Canada with tariffs and claimed his tough stance on immigration led Mexico to curb illegal crossings. He also outlined plans for stricter immigration and election laws, while celebrating his past achievements. Canadian and Mexican officials offered contrasting accounts of their interactions with Trump.
summary: At a Fox Nation awards ceremony, former President Trump recounted threatening Canada with tariffs and claimed his tough stance on immigration led Mexico to curb illegal crossings.  He also outlined plans for stricter immigration and election laws, while celebrating his past achievements.  Canadian and Mexican officials offered contrasting accounts of their interactions with Trump.

title: Prince Harry was forced to dismiss Meghan Markle divorce rumors because...
content: Prince Harry's statement on rumors of his divorce from Meghan Markle looked forced, according to experts, as if to keep the buzz on as Harry was asked about the constant glare on their lives, not directly about the rumors of divorce. Experts said Harry pounced on the opportunity and mentioned the divorce as both Harry and Meghan were aware of the rumors and saw it as an opportunity to further their brand.
summary: Prince Harry's statement on rumors of his divorce from Meghan Markle looked forced, according to experts, as if to keep the buzz on as Harry was asked about the constant glare on their lives, not directly about the rumors of divorce. Experts said Harry pounced on the opportunity and mentioned the divorce as both Harry and Meghan were aware of the rumors and saw it as an opportunity to further their brand.

title: TikTok faces looming ban in US as appeals court upholds divestment law
content: A US appeals court upheld a law mandating ByteDance to divest TikTok's US operations by January 19, 2025, or face a nationwide ban. The ruling intensifies US-China tensions, with TikTok planning a Supreme Court appeal. The decision's enforcement rests with the incoming Biden administration, impacting the social media landscape and US-China relations.
summary: A US appeals court upheld a law mandating ByteDance to divest TikTok's US operations by January 19, 2025, or face a nationwide ban.  The ruling intensifies US-China tensions, with TikTok planning a Supreme Court appeal.  The decision's enforcement rests with the incoming Biden administration, impacting the social media landscape and US-China relations.

title: Mannheim knife attack: Stabbed German activist now faces legal action
content: Anti-Islam activist Michael Stürzenberger, recently attacked by an Afghan refugee in Mannheim where a policeman died, has been fined €3,600 for inciting hatred. A Hamburg court convicted him for remarks made at a 2020 rally, reducing a prior prison sentence due to the assassination attempt.
summary: Anti-Islam activist Michael Stürzenberger, recently attacked by an Afghan refugee in Mannheim where a policeman died, has been fined €3,600 for inciting hatred. A Hamburg court convicted him for remarks made at a 2020 rally, reducing a prior prison sentence due to the assassination attempt.

title: Taylor Lorenz defends 'celebrating' Brian Thompson's murder: 'If you have watched...'
content: Former Washington Post reporter Taylor Lorenz defended her comments on the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, stating she was voicing the anger of many Americans facing healthcare system hardships. Lorenz said it was natural for anyone to feel happy because CEOs like Brian Thompson caused the deaths of many people by denying them their insurance coverage -- which is also violence.
summary: Former Washington Post reporter Taylor Lorenz defended her comments on the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, stating she was voicing the anger of many Americans facing healthcare system hardships.  Lorenz said it was natural for anyone to feel happy because CEOs like Brian Thompson caused the deaths of many people by denying them their insurance coverage -- which is also violence.

title: Barack Obama accuses GOP of justice system misuse, public reacts: 'Bro lacks a mirror'
content: Former US President Barack Obama's remarks at the Democracy Forum sparked controversy. He criticized using the justice system against political rivals, drawing accusations of hypocrisy from Republicans citing Democrats' actions against Trump. Obama described the political landscape as a "doom loop" of polarization, with each side believing the other manipulates the system.
summary: Former US President Barack Obama's remarks at the Democracy Forum sparked controversy. He criticized using the justice system against political rivals, drawing accusations of hypocrisy from Republicans citing Democrats' actions against Trump. Obama described the political landscape as a "doom loop" of polarization, with each side believing the other manipulates the system.

title: Brian Thompson's killer is not a hitman? 3 reasons why experts think so
content: ​Experts who analyzed the CCTV footage claimed that though the killer was deft in handling the gun, he might not be a trained shooter because he had to fire many shots and shooting in the calf is not a sign of a professional hire, they think. Though the killer is yet to be traced, experts feel he was not a professional hitman and probably acted out of personal vendetta.
summary: ​Experts who analyzed the CCTV footage claimed that though the killer was deft in handling the gun, he might not be a trained shooter because he had to fire many shots and shooting in the calf is not a sign of a professional hire, they think. Though the killer is yet to be traced, experts feel he was not a professional hitman and probably acted out of personal vendetta.

title: ‘I’m for America’: NYC Mayor Eric Adams leaves door open to potential GOP switch
content: NYC Mayor Eric Adams, a Democrat, hinted at a possible return to the Republican Party, emphasizing national unity over party lines. He praised bipartisanship and avoided criticizing Trump, sparking controversy among fellow Democrats. Adams faces federal charges, and Trump's potential influence on the case adds complexity. He plans to seek re-election as a Democrat.
summary: NYC Mayor Eric Adams, a Democrat, hinted at a possible return to the Republican Party, emphasizing national unity over party lines.  He praised bipartisanship and avoided criticizing Trump, sparking controversy among fellow Democrats.  Adams faces federal charges, and Trump's potential influence on the case adds complexity.  He plans to seek re-election as a Democrat.

title: Will Melania Trump never appear on the cover of any magazine as First Lady? Is it a dig at Jill Biden?
content: Melania Trump dismissed the snub by the magazines that she was not featured on the cover of any during her first stint as the first lady as she said she has many important things to do other than appearing on the cover of any magazine. "I think the life would not change for anybody if I am on the cover of any magazine," Melania said in a Fox interview in a veiled dig at Jill Biden who was the Vogue cover for August.
summary: Melania Trump dismissed the snub by the magazines that she was not featured on the cover of any during her first stint as the first lady as she said she has many important things to do other than appearing on the cover of any magazine. "I think the life would not change for anybody if I am on the cover of any magazine," Melania said in a Fox interview in a veiled dig at Jill Biden who was the Vogue cover for August.

title: Brian Thompson killing: UnitedHealthcare removes executive info from website after CEO's death
content: Days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed in a targeted shooting, the company removed its executive list from its website. Thompson, 50, was fatally shot while walking to a conference in Midtown Manhattan. Investigators are probing links between the attack and Thompson’s role in the insurance industry, with evidence including engraved shell casings and a suspect using fake IDs.
summary: Days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed in a targeted shooting, the company removed its executive list from its website. Thompson, 50, was fatally shot while walking to a conference in Midtown Manhattan. Investigators are probing links between the attack and Thompson’s role in the insurance industry, with evidence including engraved shell casings and a suspect using fake IDs.

title: 'Ashamed to be an American': Teacher claims she was fired for posting anti-Trump content on social media
content: A Beverly Hills teacher, Joanie Garratt, alleges she was fired for criticizing pro-Trump student behavior and the former president on her private Facebook account. The school district denies firing her, claiming she was a substitute teacher whose assignment ended. The incident followed a pro-Trump rally where students allegedly harassed classmates, sparking debate about free speech and educator rights.
summary: A Beverly Hills teacher, Joanie Garratt, alleges she was fired for criticizing pro-Trump student behavior and the former president on her private Facebook account. The school district denies firing her, claiming she was a substitute teacher whose assignment ended. The incident followed a pro-Trump rally where students allegedly harassed classmates, sparking debate about free speech and educator rights.

title: JD Vance explains how he and his 'closest friends in tech world' David Sacks became pro-Trump
content: JD Vance lauded David Sacks, a close friend and tech entrepreneur, for his transition to a staunch Trump supporter. Both initially critical of Trump in 2016, they united by 2020, viewing Trump as crucial against political and cultural 'insanity.
summary: JD Vance lauded David Sacks, a close friend and tech entrepreneur, for his transition to a staunch Trump supporter. Both initially critical of Trump in 2016, they united by 2020, viewing Trump as crucial against political and cultural 'insanity.

title: Merciful President? After Hunter, Biden is considering pre-emptive pardons for these individuals
content: Among those reportedly being considered for pardons are Anthony S. Fauci, known for leading the US covid-19 response; retired General Mark A. Milley, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who called Trump a "fascist"; Senator-elect Adam Schiff (D-California), who led Trump’s first impeachment; and ex-Congresswoman Liz Cheney (R-Wyoming), a prominent Republican critic of Trump.
summary: Among those reportedly being considered for pardons are Anthony S. Fauci, known for leading the US covid-19 response; retired General Mark A. Milley, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who called Trump a "fascist"; Senator-elect Adam Schiff (D-California), who led Trump’s first impeachment; and ex-Congresswoman Liz Cheney (R-Wyoming), a prominent Republican critic of Trump.

title: Why is JetBlue announcing major route cuts to these US cities?
content: JetBlue Airways is restructuring its flight network in 2025, cutting routes from major hubs like JFK, Miami, and Austin to boost profitability. The airline will eliminate flights to destinations such as Houston, Paris, and London Gatwick, while also discontinuing Mint service on Seattle routes. This decision follows challenges in Florida's competitive market and anticipated aircraft groundings due to engine issues.
summary: JetBlue Airways is restructuring its flight network in 2025, cutting routes from major hubs like JFK, Miami, and Austin to boost profitability.  The airline will eliminate flights to destinations such as Houston, Paris, and London Gatwick, while also discontinuing Mint service on Seattle routes.  This decision follows challenges in Florida's competitive market and anticipated aircraft groundings due to engine issues.

title: How 'AI Czar' David Sacks and tech bros helped Trump red-pill America
content: Silicon Valley’s conservative-libertarian contingent has long criticised Washington’s bureaucracy as a brake on innovation. Now, with Sacks at the helm, that contingent stands to reshape America’s AI, cryptocurrency, and digital policy landscape, with promises of deregulation and market-driven leadership.
summary: Silicon Valley’s conservative-libertarian contingent has long criticised Washington’s bureaucracy as a brake on innovation. Now, with Sacks at the helm, that contingent stands to reshape America’s AI, cryptocurrency, and digital policy landscape, with promises of deregulation and market-driven leadership.

title: Melania Trump says it's not possible for Barron to be a 'normal student' because...
content: In her first Fox interview since Donald Trump's re-election, Melania Trump discussed Barron's crucial role in Donald Trump's campaigning. ​He brought in so many young people of his generation... because nowadays the young generation doesn't sit in front of the TV anymore; they are all on the tablets, on their phones. It's incredible how Barron brought in success as he knew exactly who his father needed to contact and to talk to," Melania said.
summary: In her first Fox interview since Donald Trump's re-election, Melania Trump discussed Barron's crucial role in Donald Trump's campaigning. ​He brought in so many young people of his generation... because nowadays the young generation doesn't sit in front of the TV anymore; they are all on the tablets, on their phones. It's incredible how Barron brought in success as he knew exactly who his father needed to contact and to talk to," Melania said.
